text: Hello everyone it's Helen here today I will make a very special Vietnamese dessert
that is probably not the most pretty one. It's called "Bánh gan"
Literally translated "Bánh gan" means "liver cake", but don't worry because this cake contains no liver
it's only called that way because
The appearance should somewhat resemble a piece of liver
Is has this dark brown grey color and the texture looks so much like liver
But don't let the look and the name of it scare you because this cake is serve cold and the flavor is rich and creamy
Quite similar to flan. It's quite a yummy treat
So let's begin
The ingredients you're gonna need:
110g of palm sugar. You can use brown sugar instead, 1 cup coconut milk
4-5 star anises,
4 eggs
Originally, this cake is made with duck eggs, but you can also use chicken eggs
a teaspoon of rice flour and 1 tablespoon of cacao powder
Firstly toast the star anises in the frying pan for about 2 minutes until fragrance
And break down the palm sugar so it's easier to melt
In a small saucepan over medium heat combine the palm sugar with a cup of coconut milk and stir to dissolve
Then toss in the toasted star anises
And when the sugar is completely melted up to about 4 minutes take off the heat and leave to cool.
next pre-heat your oven to 280 degrees Celsius or 375 Fahrenheit
and
grease a baking pan
I use a 20-centimeter or an 8-inch pan with some cooking oil or spray and
Put into the oven to heat it up at the same time
crack four eggs in a bowl and use the whisk to break up the yolk and stir it until homogeneous
make sure that the whisk always touches the bottom of the bowl to avoid creating too much bubbles
next in a small bowl mix a tablespoon of
rice flour with two tablespoon of water and then in another bowl mix a teaspoon of cacao powder with a
tablespoon of hot water and stir to dissolve
Then add this to the eggs mixture and stir to combine
The pan has been heated in the oven for about ten minutes
It's now nice and hot just take it out using kitchen gloves and then immediately pour the mixture into the pan
through a sieve
You would hear a sizzling sound
That's a good sign back into the oven. It goes. Just bake for 40 minutes at 180 degree Celsius or 375 degree
Fahrenheit until done we can test the doneness by inserting
A toothpick into the center if it comes clean it's done
Let it cool completely before removing from the mold
It still smells not so pleasant at this point, but don't worry
Just put it in the refrigerator until the next day
so the flavor had time to settle and then you will be rewarded with a very fragrant piece of custard.
It's so unique both in terms of look and taste
Let's cut out a slice if the sidecut looks like an overbaked flan with many little holes. That's how it's supposed to be
Same look like a slice of liver right? It's extraordinary
If you want to try out something different, please give this recipe a try
It's really fun to make and you will be really excited to see the result
I hope you're gonna give it a try
And if you do, please share with me a photo on instagram with hashtag helen recipes and let's enjoy together online
Don't forget to click like and subscribe to my channel for more amazing Vietnamese food and desserts
Thank you for watching. Bye
